title: How to Access the X (Formerly Twitter) Media Studio: Complete Guide

steps.title: Log in to your X account.
steps.content: Log in to your X account. If you haven't already done so, go to https://www.x.com in your desktop browser and log in with your username/email and password. If you have already signed in to your account, simply skip this step. In order to access the X Media Studio, you will need to have an X Premium subscription. You can sign up for a subscription at https://x.com/i/verified-choose . [1] X Research source

steps.title: Click on the ⋯ More option.
steps.content: Click on the ⋯ More option. This will be located on the left side panel. A drop-down sow up.

steps.title: Select Media Studio from the list.
steps.content: Select Media Studio from the list. It will be located between Analytics and Settings and privacy options.

steps.title: Directly access the media studio if you'd like.
steps.content: Directly access the media studio if you'd like. You can also go directly to https://studio.x.com instead of accessing the site via X/Twitter. Simply sign in with your credentials and you're ready to go.

steps.title: You must have an X subscription to see the X Media Studio.
steps.content: You must have an X subscription to see the X Media Studio. If you don't see "Media Studio" option in the More menu, it's because you haven't yet verified your X account by upgrading to X Premium. X Media Studio is not available for users who have free unverified accounts. You must subscribe in order to access it. You can sign up for a subscription at https://x.com/i/verified-choose . [2] X Research source

steps.title: The X Media Studio is a built-in tool to manage your X accounts.
steps.content: The X Media Studio is a built-in tool to manage your X accounts. It is especially handy if you run multiple accounts that produce monetized content. There are five tools included in the X Media Studio: [3] X Research source Library: The Library allows you to see all of the media content that's been posted on your account. This includes videos, GIFs, and images. You can also use the media library to upload media that you can post to your X account. [4] X Research source Analytics: The Analytics tool allows you to see various analytic data for your posts and media. This includes total views, organic views, promoted views, video completion rate, average watch time, country of viewership, and platform of viewership. [5] X Research source Producer: Producer allows users to go live on X using streaming software and external cameras (i.e. not your phone camera). Producer also saves your past broadcasts and includes some analytics for your broadcasts. [6] X Research source LiveCut: LiveCut is a video editing tool included with Producer. LiveCut allows you to take clips from current or past live broadcasts and edit them so you can post them on your X account. [7] X Research source Monetization: The X Media Studio has two ways to monetize your videos: Amplify Pre-roll and Amplify Sponsorships. Amplify Pre-roll allows you to add pre-roll ads to your videos, as long as your content is brand-safe. Amplify Sponsorships is a program that connects you with advertisers who want to advertise to your audience. In both cases, you'll need to work with your X account manager to learn more. [8] X Research source
